    • Method Detail

      • toChunkIndexData

        public DocumentChunkIndexData toChunkIndexData()
        Converts this instance into the persistable DocumentChunkIndexData format.

        The returned object will contain a copy of the data stored in this index. This object can be used as usual after invoking this method, it will have no effect on the returned object.

        Returns:
        The persistable version of this index. The contained data is a copy, sharing no mutable references with the "live" system. Never null.

      • isPersistent

        public boolean isPersistent()

      • setPersistent

        public void setPersistent(boolean persistent)

      • getDocumentsTouchedAtOrAfterTimestamp

        public java.util.Set<ChronoIndexDocument> getDocumentsTouchedAtOrAfterTimestamp(long timestamp,
                                                                                java.util.Set<java.lang.String> branches)
        Description copied from class: AbstractDocumentBasedIndexManagerBackend
        Returns the set of documents that were added and/or modified exactly at the given timestamp, or after the given timestamp.
        Overrides:
        getDocumentsTouchedAtOrAfterTimestamp in class InMemoryIndexManagerBackend
        Parameters:
        timestamp - The timestamp in question. Must not be negative.
        branches - The set of branches to retrieve the documents for. If null, documents from all branches will be retrieved. If this set is empty, then the result set will also be empty.
        Returns:
        The set of index documents that were added and/or modified exactly at or after the given timestamp. May be empty, but never null.
